title: Gemma Collins looks in good spirits as she sports a bold pink suit at perfume launch
text:
Gemma Collins made her first public appearance since she was reportedly left in fear that her on/off boyfriend James Argent had overdosed.

The TOWIE star, 38, looked in good spirits as she stormed the red carpet for the launch of her Diva Pink perfume at Martha's Soho in London on Monday.

Ensuring she'd turn heads on the outing, Gemma opted for a bold look in a glittering rose co-ord that complemented the pink theme of the evening.

Making an entrance: Gemma Collins 38, looked in good spirits as she stormed the red carpet for the launch of her Diva Pink perfume at Martha's Soho in London on Monday

Gemma was dressed to impress as she slipped into a head turning wide legged trousers and matching jacket

She layered the blazer over a low-cut bustier that offered a look at her ample cleavage.

Gemma completed the look with a bold choice of accessories, sporting pearl adorned headwear, and framing her peepers with hot pink eye shadow.

Pretty in pink: Ensuring she'd turn heads on the outing, Gemma opted for a bold look in a glittering rose co-ord that complemented the pink theme of the evening

Oozing glamour: Gemma was dressed to impress as she slipped into a head turning wide legged trousers and matching jacket

Chest a glimpse: Gemma layered the blazer over a low-cut bustier that offered a look at her ample cleavage

Look who it is! Gemma's arrival to the event was anything but low-key as she turned up with a giant black and white portrait of herself in her hands

The outing came shortly after Gemma reportedly called 999 over fears her ex boyfriend Arg had overdosed.

According to The Sun , police 'broke into' the TOWIE star's home on Thursday after he failed to return his friends' phone calls.





Two police cars and two ambulance crews made their way to Arg's £1.3million home over concerns he had collapsed.

Pals: Gemma was joined at the bash by her friend and former Dancing On Ice partner Matt Evers

Mwah: The former TOWIE star planted a tender kiss on Matt's cheek at the event

Friends: Also showing their support was Darby Ward and her fiancé Michael Jackson

Work it: Gemma posed up a storm with her new perfume bottle as she pouted and spritzed it in the air

On the mend: Helen Flanagan looked happy and healthy as she headed to the launch of Gemma' s new fragrance after she revealed the week before that she had burned her foot

Nailed it: Helen revealed that she'd not only recovered from her foot injury, but remastered the art of walking in heels, as she headed to the event

Delightful duo: Helen was joined at the event by her hairdresser pal Jay Birmingham, who went shirtless beneath a salmon corduroy trouser suit

Pretty in pink: Tallia Storm also attended the event and made a bold style statement in hot pink trousers teamed with a black cut away top

According to the publication, Gemma dialled 999 after Arg's parents were unable to get into his house where he lives by himself.

Medics examined the reality star and his parents reportedly insisted that they could look after him.

However, three hours later they are said to have raised the alarm again over 'further concerns for his welfare'.

See you later: Gemma was seen carrying one of her own goodie bags as she headed to The Dorchester Hotel

Happy: Gemma appeared in good spirits as she waved to fans outside

Glowing: The star showcased her slimmed-down frame in the pink glittery trouser suit

Appearance: Gemma made her first public appearance since she was reportedly left in fear that her on/off boyfriend James Argent had overdosed (pictured in October 2018)

In a statement given to The Sun, James insisted he was fine and the reason he did not answer his phone was because he 'wasn't speaking to a certain person'.

He said: ‘I wasn’t speaking to a certain person so I didn’t reply. They became concerned and called the police and ambulance.

'They turned up and checked on me. They came up to my room to make sure I was fine.’

The ambulance crew reportedly arrived to his home in South Woodford, North East London, shortly before 1pm with the police arriving soon after.

When the cops got inside, they assessed Arg but then got a second call at 4:20pm before a third ambulance arrived.

Arg said his parents were already in his home checking up on him when 'this person' called the emergency services again.

Raising the alarm: Gemma is said to have dialled 999 after Arg's parents were unable to get into his house where he lives by himself (pictured in November 2017)

After the ambulance arrived at his house after 4pm, Arg said he had a quick chat with them on his doorstep, adding the police and paramedics were only at his house for about 10 minutes.

The reality star added that he was 'slightly embarassed' by the incident and apologised for any wasted police time as he was 'absolutely fine'.

The Metropolitan Police said in a statement: ‘Police were called at 13.11hrs to a residential address following concerns for the welfare of male occupant.

'Officers attended with LAS (London Ambulance Service). The male, in his 30s, was spoken to. He was left in the company of family. Officers were called at 16.21hrs to the same address, again due to concerns for the same male’s welfare. The male declined assistance.’

In August last year, Arg returned to rehab following a split from Gemma in a brave bid to tackle his demons.

The TV star spent three months in a facility in Thailand over the festive season in 2016 in a bid to curb his wild ways and revealed that he checked himself in to a programme in order to get the 'ongoing support' he needed.

He also spent time in The Priory for alleged drink and drug issues in 2014.
description: The TOWIE star, 38, looked in good spirits as she stormed the red carpet for the launch of her Diva Pink perfume at Martha's Soho in London on Monday.
